title: What are the dangers of following illusions and distractions during spiritual practice according to "Il Fiore d'Oro del Grande Uno"?
first_phrase: In this last part, the text discusses the "Defense of the Middle Way," a concept aimed at preserving the Yellow Center by balancing conscious and primordial instincts. It identifies distraction and inertia as major obstacles to this task, with the latter being more difficult to overcome. Additionally, the text warns of negative images and illusions that could arise during the practice and after death. It advises readers to avoid being enchanted by these apparitions to avoid being misled. The text also references the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" for comparison.
content: Chi la percorre, invece di raggiungere « lo spazio della forza », mèta della fase successiva ed essenziale dell'opera, finisce nelle « profondi tà della fantasia » corrispondenti al « inondo dei dèmoni », al « mondo dei desideri e delle illusioni ». A tali esperien ze che si possono avere durante la pratica fanno riscontro quelle analoghe che si hanno dopo la morte: il lettore può riandare al « Libro tibetano del morto », ove si parla del bardo e delle sue apparizioni fallaci,, celesti o infernali. last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to be mindful of the potential pitfalls and illusions one may encounter while on the path of spiritual practice. The direction advocated in this text may be opposite to that of certain psychoanalytic methods. The next phase of the work involves the transformation of the light and the union with the transforming force, vital for the growth of the spiritual flame. Failure to complete the entire process may result in a lack of manifestation and progress.
